title: How to Make an Avocado, Walnut and Fried Polenta Salad

steps.headline: Mix dried polenta, water and seasoning in a microwave safe bowl.
steps.description:
Microwave for 2 minutes then stir, microwave another 2 minutes or until thick and smooth. Stir in the butter and check for seasoning. Spread 1cm or 1/2 inch thick on an oiled plate or greaseproof paper. Allow to cool until firm (about 20 minutes in the fridge) and then slice into wedges. You may cook the polenta in advance which is recommended, or cook it on the stove top. Polenta is one of the few dishes that cooks well in a microwave and by making it the night before when you are cooking dinner makes the cooking the next day even easier. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Make-an-Avocado%2C-Walnut-and-Fried-Polenta-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-an-Avocado%2C-Walnut-and-Fried-Polenta-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Make-an-Avocado%2C-Walnut-and-Fried-Polenta-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-an-Avocado%2C-Walnut-and-Fried-Polenta-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Fry or grill the polenta wedges until crisp and golden in about 1 tablespoon of oil.
steps.description: Keep the wedges hot if you are cooking them in batches.

steps.headline: Slice the avocado, cheese and apple, slicing them into small portions.
steps.description: The walnuts may be served directly from the packed, or roughly chopped.

steps.headline: Serve the hot polenta, with the avocado, cheese, fruit and nuts.
steps.description: Season well and serve immediately. This salad may also be expanded with some fresh rocket leaves with a good vinaigrette dressing with the salad mixed in a bowl like any tossed salad just before serving. As it is, its desirable to have the salad portions separately to get maximum flavour and texture impact. Generally the textures as they are means the salad may be served without dressing, but can be good with any light dressing such as a balsamic or wine vinegar dressing.
